Note: Although MR glasses and neural band were paired, screen would not activate with neural band but would activate with voice command
To troubleshoot, I factory reset the band and the glasses and paired them again which was successful in ultimately connecting the devices
Participant believes that screen could be brighter watching reels on display and enjoys being able to to change the level
Participant notices that the reels that appear when viewing them in the glasses are completely different than the reels on the phone
Reels on the glasses display cute animals and pets while reels on phone reflect content that participant finds more interesting
Participant would make the screen within the glasses bigger if they could but would not change the position of the screen within the glasses
Participant says they could see how someone’s fingers would get tired after a while of manipulating screen with hand gestures as soft movements aren’t captured and finger movements must be firm
Participant would prefer content to be the same across devices
Neural band is responsive to participant’s hand gestures
Participant notices a glare caused by top overhead light but says it doesn’t really affect the clarity of the screen
Participant would prefer watching reels on MR display as they have more flexibility with the positioning of their head but still appreciates the size of phone display
Reels on MR display not loading. Thumbnails are loading but videos are not
